clinical_study.brief_title: Could the Intraoperative Radiation Exposure (Fluoroscopy) of Percutaneous Pedicle Screw Fixation be Reduced Using an Electronic Conductivity Device?
clinical_study.official_title: Could the Intraoperative Radiation Exposure (Fluoroscopy) of Percutaneous Pedicle Screw Fixation be Reduced Using an Electronic Conductivity Device? A Prospective, Randomized Study

brief_summary.textblock: To compare classical pedicle finder versus pedicle finder with impedancemetry on the perioperative radiation exposure of PPTLO. These two devices are already used in common practice.

secondary_outcome.measure: Radiation duration in seconds (measured on the fluoroscope);
secondary_outcome.description: Radiation duration in seconds (measured on the fluoroscope);

Radiation rate on:1 ring carried by the surgeon (passive dosimeter),1 passive dosimeter worn at the surgeon's eye level, 1 passive dosimeter on the fluoroscope,1 active dosimeter placed on the bust of the surgeon under the lead apron

arm_group.description: Spinal osteosynthesis realized with a classical pedicle finder
Spinal osteosynthesis realized with a pedicle finder with impedancemetry

intervention.description: Posterior thoracic and lumbar osteosynthesis with classical pedicle finder or with pedicle finder with impedancemetry
